questions.answer_description: Capabilities Assignment allows system administrators to enable the Cisco Unified Presence (CUP) and Cisco Unified Personal Communicator (CUPC) capabilities for users. You must ensure that licenses for CUP and CUPC are available.
questions.question_text: In which location is Cisco Unified Presence enabled for a specific user in Cisco Unified Communications Manager?
Which industry standard method does Cisco Unified Presence incorporate for communication between different IM clients?
A voicemail user reports that he cannot access Cisco Unity Connection from the IP phone message button. Which option must you perform to resolve the problem?

discussion.content: C. In Cisco Unified Communications Manager, navigate to Device > Phone to confirm that the directory number has the correct voicemail profile

choices.A: In Cisco Unified Communications Manager, navigate to Advanced Features > Voicemail to confirm that the user has the correct voicemail profile
choices.E: In Cisco Unity Connection, navigate to Users > Users to confirm that the user web password is correct. C
choices.C: In Cisco Unified Communications Manager, navigate to Device > Phone to confirm that the directory number has the correct voicemail profile
choices.B: In Cisco Unified Communications Manager, navigate to Device > Phone to confirm that the device has the correct voicemail profile
choices.D: In Cisco Unified Communications Manager, navigate to User Management > End User to confirm that the user has the correct voicemail profile

questions.question_text:
An engineer must ensure that user data is maintained in a directory server and copied to Cisco Unity Connection via lightweight directory access protocol, but
Cisco Unity Connection-specific data is locally maintained in the Cisco Unity Connection database. Which user creation accomplishes this task?

discussion.content:
I think the answer should be C 
https://books.google.co.il/books?id=xyCvCgAAQBAJ&pg=PT566&lpg=PT566&dq=locally+maintained+users+in+CUC+and+import+from+LDAP&source=bl&ots=QfK5a7SQil&sig=ACfU3U2l2vSd0YyMHr8ZZhTiNBUNZSXfbQ&hl=en&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwiaz_jt2cLnAhUKRBUIHWEdD6cQ6AEwAHoECAsQAQ#v=onepage&q=locally%20maintained%20users%20in%20CUC%20and%20import%20from%20LDAP&f=false

questions.question_text: An IT administrator must allow a customer service department supervisor to change or modify a recorded message on their phone system. Which role is needed to accomplish this?
